org.jerkar.api.depmanagement
Class JkScopeMapping

java.lang.Object
  org.jerkar.api.depmanagement.JkScopeMapping
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class JkScopeMapping
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

A mapping from scopes to scopes acting when declaring dependencies. The goal of a scope mapping is to determine :

  • with which scopes a dependency is declared for
  • for each scope a dependency is declared for, which scopes of this transitive dependencies to retrieve
. For example, Your component 'A' depends of component 'B' for compiling. You can declare 'A' depends of 'B' with scope 'compile'.
Now imagine that for compiling, 'A' needs also the test class of 'B' along the dependencies 'B' needs for testing. For such, you can declare a scope mapping as 'compile->compile, test'. This concept matches strictly with the configuration concept found in Ivy : see here..

See Also:

public JkScopeMapping.Partial and(JkScope... from)
